etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 甫(甫) (fǔ) = action involving the mouth -> nourish; feed
etymology.interpretation: The character 哺(bǔ, "nourish; feed") combines the semantic element 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth"), indicating an action related to the mouth, with the phonetic element 甫(甫) (fǔ), to suggest the sounds involved in feeding or nourishing.

examples.chinese: 母亲哺乳婴儿(母親哺乳嬰兒)。
农夫细心哺养牲畜(農夫細心哺養牲畜)，让它们健康成长(讓它們健康成長)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngfū xìxīn bǔyǎng shēngchù, ràng tāmen jiànkāng chéngzhǎng.
examples.english: The farmer carefully nourishes the livestock, allowing them to grow healthily.
